intro: Pentaschistis viscidula, commonly known as the sticky pentaschistis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its sticky leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
